definition:
Let $\mathcal C$ be a category and $A$ be an object in this category.
*epimorphic hull* of $A$ is an object $E\in\mathrm{Ob}(C)$ such that
there is an $f:A\rightarrow E$ that has the following property :

1.  $f$ is an epimorphic extension

2.  $f$ is an essential extension

3.  $f$ is (roughly put “maximal epimorphic and essential extension”)
    has the property that for any epimorphic and essential extension
    $g:A\rightarrow B$, there exists a morphism $g:B\rightarrow E$ such
    that $$f=g\circ h$$

We used “the epimorphic hull”, because it can be proven that if an
epimorphic hull exists for an object of the category, it is unique upto
isomorphism.

In the category of semiprime commutative ring the epimorphic hull for
every semiprime ring exist. The epimorphic hull of a reduced ring is the
intersection of all the von Neumann regular rings that lie between the
ring and its complete ring of quotient.
